title: Louis Vuitton: Monogram as Status Symbol
description: A fast breakdown of Louis Vuitton: Monogram as Status Symbol for builders.

hook.text: The LV monogram was created in 1896 to fight counterfeits. It became the world's most copied pattern.

buildup.text: Georges Vuitton designed it after his father's death â€” interlocking L and V plus flower motifs.

discovery.text: The pattern made every product instantly identifiable and nearly impossible to copy at the time.

twist.text: Today, LV counterfeits are a multi-billion-dollar industry. The anti-fraud design became the most faked.

climax.text: The LV monogram proved that a pattern can carry brand identity as powerfully as any logo.

punchline.text: The ultimate anti-counterfeit design became the most counterfeited.

quiz.question: Why was the LV monogram originally created?
